result.execSummary:
The defendant Donntrell Monte Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 4-21-14 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection - bail to apply.
Huber for work and school. Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donntrell Monte Harper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction with Huber for work and school; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 4-21-14 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection - bail to apply.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Court vacates the bench warrant.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of THC 961.41(3g)(e) a misdemeanor.

Attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Cimpl-Wiemer states the defendant's grandmother passed away and the funeral services are to be held on 4-17-14.  The defendant does not have a driver's license and cannot find a ride to the courthouse.  Court requires defendant to bring in the obituary at the next date.  Court stays a bench warrant to the next date.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State moves for an adjournment.  State has received new information and would like to reevaluate the offer.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

14RM016004  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
 03-21-14

Attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Donntrell Monte Harper not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
